attributes.title: #300 - January 7, 2022
attributes.description:
It’s episode 300! Raise a glass! Our wonderful patrons give us lots of memories and conversation starters to mark the milestone. All while feeling the intensity of Q1’s release schedule, the cheap-high-tech possibilities of PSVR2, and the long and lonely road of Days Gone.

attributes.title: #301 - January 14, 2022
attributes.description:
This week was filled with uncertainty. Is Mario Kart 9 happening soon? Will Babylon’s fall and a new leader hurt Platinum Games? Can FF XIV’s director make people nicer? Should LEGO ever trust Blizzard again? Am I playing the right Wordle? Where’s my PS5 and Xbox Series X?!

attributes.title: #302 - January 21, 2022
attributes.description:
Phil Spencer owns this podcast after dropping the biggest gaming news of the year, and it’s still the first month of 2022. After we discuss 6 different factors of Activision/Blizzard's big payday, the panel laments Star Wars causing crunch and that’s it. It’s mostly Xbox this week.

attributes.description:
This week is mostly about new stuff. Blizzard’s trying the survival genre, Crysis is ready for a sequel, Respawn is working on 2 more Star Wars games than we knew, Nagoshi launched his new studio, and Meta has something scary in VR called Horizon.

attributes.description:
Sony strikes back by acquiring Bungie and getting to work on 10+ live service games. Also, Yacht Club still kicks it with Kickstarter, Gran Turismo still looks gorgeous, Nintendo still makes boatloads of money, and the Dark Pictures Anthology still dares to dream.

attributes.title: #306 - February 18, 2022
attributes.description:
Nintendo's announced the death of 3DS and Wii U stores, Capcom put up a mysterious countdown, and Lost Ark has made all the right moves to have an absolutely explosive launch.

Note: We're aware of some missing bits and bobs here and there. Apologies as we had to edit this week without Brandon.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast #310 - Mar 18, 2022
attributes.description: It's a big week for indie games, teen summer horror is back in style, and Perfect Dark loses some initiative.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast #311 - Mar 25, 2022
attributes.description: This week, we have an open discussion on Hogwarts Legacy, the next Witcher games will run on a new engine, and bustin' makes us feel good.

attributes.title: Can PS Plus Compete with Game Pass? - Easy Allies Podcast - Apr 1, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 312 - Long rumored changes to PlayStation Plus are now official, Zelda has been forseeably delayed, and E3 2022 is cancelled again.

attributes.title: Max and Lara Are on the Way! - Easy Allies Podcast - Apr 8, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 313 - Tomb Raider is being made on Unreal Engine 5, Remedy is remaking Max Payne 1 and 2, and we take a look at our most anticipated games this spring.

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts IV Outta Nowhere! - Easy Allies Podcast - Apr 15, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 314 - We saw the next chapter of Kingdom Hearts far sooner than expected, Oddworld's popularity is "devastating," and Resident Evil Village almost had mermaids.

attributes.title: Are GBA Games Coming to Switch? - Easy Allies Podcast - Apr 22, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 315 - It seems official Game Boy emulators have leaked for Switch, Sega wants Crazy Taxi to go up against Fortnite, and Amy Hennig is getting another shot to fulfill her Star Wars dreams.

attributes.title: Brandon's Farewell Episode - Easy Allies Podcast - Apr 29, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 316 - It's time to wish our co-founder a happy retirement, and there couldn't be a better send off than the announcement of a "life-sim adventure" with Disney friends.

attributes.title: Square Enix Dumps Tomb Raider and Deus Ex - Easy Allies Podcast - May 6, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 317 - Square Enix sells off major studios, Warcraft's mobile efforts underwhelm, and we try to figure out Neil Blomkamp's pitch for battle royale 2.0.

attributes.title: Hope for Gotham Knights? - Easy Allies Podcast - May 13, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 318 - We've gotten a fresh look at gameplay in Gotham Knights and hope it looks better next time. We also find out the truth about Duke Nukem Forever and dig into Nintendo and PlayStation's latest reports.

attributes.title: How Many Silent Hills Are There? - Easy Allies Podcast - May 20, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 319 - Silent Hill leaks lead to more reports, PS Plus reveals its new library, and Xbox wants to validate your discs.

attributes.title: Do We Want Another Death Stranding? - Easy Allies Podcast - May 27, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 320 - Norman slipped up, PlayStation is shifting gears for the future, and vampires are taking over Twitch.

attributes.title: PlayStation Starts Summer with a Bang! - Easy Allies Podcast - June 3, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 321 - Sony brought a killer lineup to its latest State of Play, including Resident Evil 4 and Final Fantasy XVI, but they aren't the only ones early to the party as we also talk about Sonic, Star Wars, and Pokemon.

attributes.title: Summer Game Fest Highs and Lows - Easy Allies Podcast - June 10, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 322 - From Street Fighter 6 to The Last of Us and beyond, we sort through our thoughts on all the announcements from Summer Game Fest, Day of the Devs, and Devolver Digital.

attributes.title: FF VII and Dragon's Dogma Sequels! - Easy Allies Podcast - June 17, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 323 - Our final episode of Summer Game Fest announcements has us picking through the Xbox and Bethesda Showcase, looking at highlights from the PC Gaming Show, and finding out that some of the best reveals were saved for last.

attributes.title: Tony Hawk Denied and Xenoblade's Rise - Easy Allies Podcast - June 24, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 324 - Hyenas are on the loose, Tony Hawk 3+4 got canned, and we learn some exciting details for Xenoblade Chronicles 3 and Final Fantasy XVI.

attributes.title: Ben Moore's Goodbye Party - Easy Allies Podcast - July 1, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 325 - It's time to give a proper send-off to one of the best in the biz, so let's get some friends together, relive some memories, and talk about Street Fighter one more time.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast - July 8, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 326 - The sun is high and it's time to see which summer games will sizzle or fizzle. Plus, God of War: Ragnarok and Skull and Bones finally got their release dates.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast - July 14, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 327 - Bayonetta 3 finally gets a release date, Skate takes fans behind the scenes for what's next, and Sega's releasing an upgraded Genesis Mini.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast - July 24, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 328 - Isla takes on hosting duties while Platinum expands towards becoming a full-fledged publisher, Warframe's devs reveal a new title, and Bruce Straley gets a flowery new studio.

attributes.title: Playing as a Woman in GTA?! - Easy Allies Podcast - July 29, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 329 - GTA VI details are on the loose, the KOTOR remake is on the rocks, Annapurna has a slate of creative new games to show off, and we discussed the mystery of the Nier Automata church right before the answer was revealed.

attributes.title: Meet Your Maker, Bagel Dog! - Easy Allies Podcast - Aug 5, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 330 - The makers of Dead by Daylight have some interesting new games on the way, Pokémon presented lots of new details on Scarlet and Violet, and Square Enix finally acknowledges the existence of Tactics Ogre: Reborn.

attributes.title: Easy Allies Podcast - Splatoon 3 Painting by Numbers? - Aug 12, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 331 - We dig into all the Splatoon 3 details from this week's Direct, check out Super Punch Out's hidden multiplayer mode, and react to all the announcements from EVO.

attributes.title: Lord of the Rings Gets Embraced - Aug 19, 2022
attributes.description:
Ep 332 - The Embracer Group is buying up everything from small indie studios to The Lord of the Rings. Alone in the Dark is making a comeback, and we missed out on a pretty cool-sounding Iron Man game. 

Support us through Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/EasyAllies

attributes.title: Gamescom Highlights and PS5 Price Hike - Aug 26, 2022
attributes.description:
Ep 333 - Germany's big show is back with plenty of new reveals to discuss, big name game creators are dipping their toes into other outlets, and Sony wants a little more cash for those PS5s. 
Support us through Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/EasyAllies

attributes.title: Halo Splits with Split-Screen - Sep 2, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 334 - Halo's roadmap sees more speedbumps with split-screen knocked off course entirely. Meanwhile, interesting investments have us speculating on From Software's future, and some fan-favorite RPGs are getting successors. Support us through Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/EasyAllies

attributes.title: The Fight for Call of Duty’s Future - Sep 9, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 335 - Sony isn't buying Xbox's friendly claims about Call of Duty. A Splitgate sequel gets started just as the original exits beta, and Cobra Kai makes us ask whether beat 'em ups are seeing a strong revival.  Support us through Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/EasyAllies

attributes.title: Oops, All Showcases! - Sep 16, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 336 - Whether they were delayed from the usual E3 season or planned for TGS, this week's had more gaming showcases than we can even keep up with.

attributes.title: Is a 4090 Really Worth It?  -  Sep 23, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 337 - Nvidia's next wave of graphics cards is here, already? And they come with a hefty price tag. Plus, Grand Theft Auto VI leaks, Suikoden returns, and Sony doesn't care about your crusty old PS VR games.

attributes.title: Stadia is Dead - Sep 30, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 338 - After years of assurances, Google has abruptly pulled the plug on Stadia, Koei Tecmo introduces a fantastic looking competitor to Monster Hunter, and E3 might actually be good again, maybe.

attributes.title: Fall 2022 Game Preview - Oct 7, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 339 - From God of War to Need for Speed, pick the highlights coming over the next 3 months, plus check in on the Mario movie teaser and get briefed on extensive plans from CD Projekt Red.

attributes.title: Premium VR and Hard Sci-Fi - Oct 14, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 340 - Meta's introducing a pricey new Quest headset, Todd Howard answers Starfield questions, and Witchfire's tearing down their invisible walls.

attributes.title: Silent Hill and Resident Evil Showdown - Oct 21, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 341 - The titans of horror face off as Silent Hill finally comes out of shadows and Resident Evil reminds people why it's been leading the way.

attributes.title: Geralt’s Getting a Makeover - Oct 28, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 342 - The original Witcher game is getting a remake, PlayStation London Studio has something new up their sleeves, and two of Rocksteady's founders are getting ready to move on.

attributes.title: PS VR2 is How Much? - Nov 4, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 343 - Sony has finally revealed the price and release date for PS VR2, as well as some games. Meanwhile, Day of the Devs celebrates 10 years of indie showcases, EA and Marvel are cozying up, and Square Enix Montreal was embraced to death.

attributes.title: Truly Mind-Blowing VR - Nov 11, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 344 - Palmer Luckey built a death helmet, Doom's composer fights for his due, Nintendo shares sales milestones, and we check out some promising new indies.

attributes.title: That Game Got Nominated For What!? - Nov 18, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 345 - Game Awards nominations have us asking and answering questions, The PC Gaming Show is back with a new fall presentation, and Saints Row's developers are being re-Embraced by Gearbox.

attributes.title: Top Turkeys of 2022 - Nov 23, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 346 - It's an early episode for the holiday weekend, and to celebrate, we look back at some of this year's most entertaining whiffs. Plus, we check out new details on One Piece and Need for Speed.

attributes.title: Spooks, Bugs, Mario, and Samurai - Dec 2, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 347 - Amnesia's got a gun, the Mario movie is checking all the right boxes, and a 12 player Starship Troopers game is on the way.

attributes.title: Game Awards Highs and Lows - Dec 9, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 348 - It's a special episode as we wrap up all the big news from this year's Game Awards, with special guest Kyle Bosman.

attributes.title: Armored Core and Wo Long Looking Strong - Dec 16, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 349 - We share our thoughts on the hot new trailer for Wo Long and hot new details for Armored Core. Plus, we check out Metacritic's worst games of 2022 and check in on November sales figures.

attributes.title: Love & Respect Special - Dec 23, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 350 - We're out and away from the news cycle, so this week is all about taking in comments, questions, and games from our community.

attributes.title: 2022 Year in Review - Dec 30, 2022
attributes.description: Ep 351 - To close out the year, we look back through 2022's biggest and most memorable headlines and discuss how they strike us today.
